page.title: 04WELTON SPRINGS TROUT FARM
page.content: Situated at an ideal site at the spring head of a tributary of the river Lud, the farm has optimum facility for trout production both for consumption and re-stocking. The water has filtered through the chalk wolds, and is free from impurities. The water volume does not fall below 1,000 gals.per minute,enough to produce 1,000,000 trout fry and fingerlings annually.Eggs are incubated in a hatchery,then transferred to circular rearing tanks until they reach a size of 75 fish per lb.The final transferance is to growing-out farms in the Louth area.A standard compounded high-protein diet is fed to the fish four times daily. Supplying fish farming eqipment to a world-wide market is another activity.
